results.name: Decimal expansion of zeta(3/2).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
A. Sakhnovich, L. Sakhnovich, Nonlinear Fokker-Planck equation: stability, distance and corresponding extremal problem in the spatially inhomogeneous case, arXiv:1307.1126 [math.AP], 2013
formula: Equals Gamma(-1/2)*zeta(-1/2)*tau(-1/2) = where tau(s) = (2*Pi*i)^(-s) + (-2*Pi*i)^(-s). This follows from the functional equation of the Riemann zeta function. (Cf. A059750, A211113, A019707). - _Peter Luschny_, May 13 2020
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Dec 30 2002
